Comment: There's been thinly veiled CCP press releases posted all over Reddit every day Reddit has existed. (Along with elsewhere on the internet for about as long.)  This is their version of the America Online free disk $90b loss - they spent too much on marketing for too little reason. But at least for a moment, they created huge internet points for their touchscreen warriors.  The vast armada of swivelchair churnalists posting effectively the same few articles every day year after year (and then sending more people/botnets in to puff the hell out of them) couldn't have been free - it's a shitload of people's whole life business which means it was an industry. An industry that returned effectively nothing on investment.
